what: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: goal autoquarto provide tools allow programmatic, incremental definition publication Quarto reports. autoquarto much work progress, developed parallel rbqmR package. rbqmR evolves, autoquarto.

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: can install development version autoquarto GitHub : autoquarto currently available CRAN.

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: fundamental class used autoquarto S4 QuartoObject class, together sub-classes, QuartoDocument, QuartoCompoundObject, QuartoBook QuartoWebsite. class hierarchy looks like : QuartoObject class single slot, variables. QuartoCompoundObject introduces three slots, named templateSearchPath, chapters type, whereas QuartoDocument class introduces single new slot, fileName.

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: chapters slot contains names files define chapters, sections, compound document. file defines single chapter. chapter form <filename>.<extension>, example introduction.qmd, folders defined templateSearchPath searched, order, first matching file used. process allows hierarchy templates used. chapter file provided absolute relative path, templateSearchPath used. file used file precise location given. templateSearchPath slot lists folders searched, order, find chapter files. variables slot used pass parameters chapter files future version autoquarto. currently used. type slot defines type quarto object (eg book website) built. value set, internally, object’s constructor.

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: Suppose company provides global templates components reports folder named ~/templates/gobal. global templates named index.qmd, conclusion.qmd environment.qmd. project team created project specific templates named conclusion.qmd, main_body.qmd intro.qmd folder named ~/templates/projectA/. project team running study named study1 provided study specific version intro.qmd ~/templates/projectA/study1. default, global template used. However, project-level version template provided, used instead global version. Similarly, study-level template override global project-level template. situation can handled setting templateSearchPath slot chapters slot value index.qmd taken ~/templates/gobal intro.qmd taken ~/templates/projectA/study1 main_body.qmd taken ~/templates/projectA/ conclusion.qmd taken ~/templates/projectA/ environment.qmd taken environment.qmd ~/specialReports/appendix3.qmd used effectively limit number entries templateSearchPath.

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: autoquarto defines constructors classes, though QuartoCompoundObjects rarely used directly. Every class -argument constructor: QuartoCompoundObjects, templateSearchPath chapter slots can set calling constructor initial creation object, entries can added slot addTemplateSearchPath addChapter methods. Similarly, fileName slot QuartoDocuments can set constructor, accessing slot directly: equivalent QuartoObject methods support piping. definition myBook equivalent default, addXXXXmethods add new entries end current list, .parameter can used insert new entry different position list: Existing elements list can deleted appropriate removeXXXX method. following code returns myBook initial state:
code: myBook <- QuartoBook() myWebsite <- QuartoWebsite() myDocument <- QuartoDocument() myBook <- QuartoBook(             templateSeachPath = list("~/templates/projectA/study1", "~/templates/projectA/", "~/templates/gobal"),             chapters=list("index.qmd", "body.qmd", "conclusion.qmd")           ) myBook <- addTemplateSearchPath(x, "~/templates/gobal") myBook <- addChapter("environment.qmd") myDocument <- QuartoDocument("myTemplateFile.qmd") myDocument <- QuartoDocument() myDocument@fileName <- "myTemplateFile.qmd" library(magrittr)  myBook <- myBook %>%              addTemplateSearchPath(x, "~/templates/gobal") %>%              addChapter("environment.qmd") myBook <- myBook %>% addChapter("~/specialReports/appendix3.qmd", .after=2) myBook <- myBook %>%              removeTemplateSearchPath(x, "~/templates/gobal") %>%              removeChapter("environment.qmd") %>%              removeChapter("~/specialReports/appendix3.qmd")

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: methods discussed added necessary information QuartoObject, can published calling publish method. publishing QuartoObject also creates log file (default, folder outFile) describing actions taken publish method. log file base name outFile timestamp appended. example, code , log file might named testReport_2023-03 Mar-07_141858.log. detail format messages log file can controlled using standard calls futile.logger functions, example; content typical log file similar
code: publish(myBook) publish(   QuartoBook(     templateSearchPath=list(testthat::test_path("testData", "global")),     chapters=list(       "index.qmd",       testthat::test_path("testData", "testParams", "introParams.qmd")     )   ),   outFile="testParamsOutput",   workDir=testthat::test_path("testData", "_work"),   params=list(     dataName="mtcars",     rowCount=10,     x="wt",     y="mpg",     g="cyl",     plotTitle="A title for the plot"   ) ) publish(   QuartoDocument(testthat::test_path("testData", "testParams", "introParams.qmd")),    outFile="testParamsOutputDocument",    workDir=testthat::test_path("testData", "_work"),   params=params ) futile.logger::flog.threshold(futile.logger::DEBUG) futile.logger::flog.layout(futile.logger::layout.format("~t ~l ~n ~f: ~m")) futile.logger::flog.appender(futile.logger::appender.console()) 2023-03-07 14:18:59 INFO [autoquarto:publish]: workDir [tests/testthat/testData/_work] is not empty.  Deleting current contents... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 INFO [autoquarto:publish]: Processing chapter files... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 INFO [autoquarto:publish]: Processing index.qmd... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: Copying '/home/kirkpatj/Packages/autoquarto/tests/testthat/testData/global/index.qmd' to 'tests/testthat/testData/_work'... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: Updating parameter YAML block... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: Done 2023-03-07 14:18:59 INFO [autoquarto:publish]: Processing tests/testthat/testData/testParams/introParams.qmd... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: Copying '/home/kirkpatj/Packages/autoquarto/tests/testthat/testData/testParams/introParams.qmd' to 'tests/testthat/testData/_work'... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: Updating parameter YAML block... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: Done 2023-03-07 14:18:59 INFO [autoquarto:publish]: Processing _quarto.yml... 2023-03-07 14:18:59 INFO [autoquarto:publish]: Writing _quarto.yml 2023-03-07 14:19:00 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: _quarto.yml is: 2023-03-07 14:19:00 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: project: 2023-03-07 14:19:00 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]:   type: book 2023-03-07 14:19:00 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]:   output-dir: /home/kirkpatj/Packages/autoquarto 2023-03-07 14:19:00 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]: book: 2023-03-07 14:19:00 DEBUG [autoquarto:publish]:   title: What is the title? what: YAML parameters in multi-file Quarto documents
title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: Unfortunately, Quarto support YAML parameters multi-file renders currently great. way create “central” definition YAML parameters. Instead, YAML parameters must repeated start every chapter file. See details. addition, chapter file passed params list contains one entries exist file’s YAML header, error occurs. Finally, another issue chapter file rendered environment. means intermediate results derived earlier chapter available current chapter, unless derivation repeated new parameters enabling derived data imported provided. Passing data frames complex R objects Quarto file YAML parameters needs little thought. two ways . First, examples , name object can passed parameter file. example: case, data frame can accessed within template file using Alternatively, can convert data frame list, YAML: case, data frame can accessed directly within template file, (though may need cast back data frame functions work expected). Obviously, data frame large, approach make YAML header quite lengthy.
code: myData <- tibble(x = 1:2, z = LETTERS[x]) --- params:   df: myData --- df <- get(params$df) ymlthis::yml_empty() %>% ymlthis::yml_params(df = ymlthis::as_yml(myData)) #> --- #> params: #>   df: #>     x: #>     - 1 #>     - 2 #>     z: #>     - A #>     - B #> --- df <- as.data.frame(params$df)

previous_headings: YAML parameters in multi-file Quarto documents
title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: Quarto books Quarto websites must include index.qmd file. limitation Quarto. See information. output-file affects single-file destinations PDF. ignored multi-file destinations html. multi-file destinations, project main file always (eg) index.html.

title: Tools to help programmatic compilation of Quarto books
text: autoquarto includes app allows users provide definitions parameters YAML header Quarto document (headers individual chapters Quarto book website). easiest way access website calling askForParams function: GUI looks like askForParamsGUI autoquarto exposes GUI server functions app module can incorporated application needed. Simply reference autoquarto::parameterEditorPanelUI autoquarto::parameterEditorServer app. vignette demonstrating simple example written.

code: if (FALSE) { publish(   QuartoBook(     templateSearchPath = list(testthat::test_path("testData", "global")),     chapters = list(       "index.qmd",       testthat::test_path("testData", "testParams", "introParams.qmd")     )   ),   outFile = "testParamsOutput",   workDir = testthat::test_path("testData", "_work"),   params = params ) } if (FALSE) { publish(   QuartoDocument(testthat::test_path("testData", "testParams", "introParams.qmd")),   outFile = "testParamsOutputDocument",   workDir = testthat::test_path("testData", "_work"),   params = list(     dataName = "mtcars",     rowCount = 10,     x = "wt",     y = "mpg",     g = "cyl",     plotTitle = "A title for the plot"   ) ) }

Replace the params Element of a File's YAML Front Matter — replaceYamlParams
text: path path file whose front matter updated params new parameter values restrict restrict updating parameters.  "none" results parameter either front matter list written edited file.  "" means parameters original front matter list included.  "file" means parameter names original front matter included list ignored.  "list" means parameters list included original front matter ignored.
